botanical_details.genus: Fuchsia can be deciduous or evergreen shrubs or trees, rarely perennials, with opposite or whorled leaves and usually pendent flowers with conspicuous tubular calyx, 4 spreading sepals and 4 erect petals

how_to_grow.cultivation: Ideal for growing under glass or in containers that can be brought indoors to overwinter. Grow in moist but well-drained potting compost, in bright filtered light with good ventilation. When in growth apply a liquid balanced fertiliser monthly. Keep just moist over winter. See tender fuchsia cultivation for more detailed advice in moist but well-drained fertile soil in a sheltered, partially shaded position. how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings in any season.
how_to_grow.pruning: Pruning Group 6. Prune back hard to ground level in early spring if an infestation of Fuchsia Gall Mite is present or if top growth dies during winter, burn cuttings.
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to fuchsia gall mite, white fly, glasshouse red spider mite, aphids.
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to fuchsia rust and grey moulds rust.
